description: Demolition of existing cloth processing works and redevelopment of a two storey, with accommodation in the roofspace, plus basement block of six flats, comprising 4 x one bed and 2 x two bed units, together with communal garden, refuse and cycle storage.
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the character and appearance of the adjacent buildings, in accordance with UDP policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of a demolition and construction method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority prior to commencement of works and the approved details shall be implemented during the demolition and construction phases.  Reason:  To protect the living and working conditions of surrounding occupiers and maintain an attractive and safe environment in the locality in accordance with policies 4.4 and 4.11 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Prior to the commencement of any works on site, the applicant shall carry out a contaminated land investigation that shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Sampling points and methods of investigation shall be agreed in writing with the Principal Environmental Health Officer prior to the investigation and if  deemed necessary by the Local Planning Authority, a scheme shall be submitted for the removal, neutralising and sealing of the contamination, and remedial works implemented before building works commence.  Reason: To ensure that the site is not hazardous, in accordance with policy 2.7 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Details of both hard and soft landscape works to the communal garden areas, including a phased programme of works, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with the programme agreed by the local planning authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the visual character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Adopted Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Detailed elevations of the boundary treatment to be erected shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority indicating the design, materials and heights in relation to ground level of the boundary structures.  The boundary treatment shall be completed in accordance with the approved details, prior to the first occupation of any of the development hereby permitted.  Reason: To protect the visual appearance of the area and the living conditions of neighbouring occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development  'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Prior to the occupation of the development the existing vehicular crossover point from Lothair Road not incorporated in the development shall be stopped up by raising the existing dropped kerb and reinstating the footway verge and highway boundary to the same line, level and detail as the adjoining footway verge and highway boundary, to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To limit the number of access points along the site boundary for the safety and convenience of the highway users in accordance with policy 9.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Details indicating the second floor east facing flank window of Flat 6 to be fixed closed and obscurely glazed shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and these works shall be carried out as approved prior to the occupation of any part of the development and retained thereafter.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of adjoining occupiers in accordance with policy 4.1 and 5.5 of the Ealing adopted Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied arrangements shall be agreed in writing with the local planning authority and be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of disabled persons, no resident of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit within any controlled parking zone to which they would otherwise be eligible at anytime and this restriction shall be registered as a Local Land Charge Search, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To prevent increased on-street car parking stress in the local area in the interests of highway safety and to prevent the displacement of existing resident car parking arrangements in accordance with policy 9.1 and 9.8 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan ' Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before the development hereby permitted is first occupied, the applicant shall provide six secure lockable parking spaces for cyclists in the location indicated on plan 674/41A received 2nd June 2010, in accordance with adopted standards and such spaces shall be retained permanently, unless otherwise approved in writing by the local planning authority.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | Details of a refuse and recycling management plan for the proposed flats to indicate how refuse is placed at an accessible point for collection by Council operatives on the designated day of collection, to accord with the standards adopted by the Local Planning Authority, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such provision shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained permanently.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of adjoining occupiers and to protect local environmental conditions, in accordance with UDP policies 2.10, 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' 2004. | The proposed residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to lifetime homes standards prior to the first occupation of any part of the development and thereafter retained.  Reason: To ensure access for all future occupiers in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.3 and 5.3 of the Ealing adopted Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 7: 'Accessible Ealing' | The development hereby authorised shall comply with 'The aims and objectives of the Police requirements of Secured By Design.'  Reason: To ensure that the proposed development achieves the required crime prevention elements as detailed by Government Circular 5/94 'Planning Out Crime', and with the requirements of Clause 17 of the Crime and Disorder Act 1998 which imposes a duty on a Local Authority 'to do all that it can to prevent crime and disorder in its area' (4.1).
